event.title: July 1882, when Northern Pacific Railway (NPR) contractors arrived

data.event: In July 1882, when Northern Pacific Railway (NPR) contractors arrived, the trading post was renamed Clark City for contractor Heman Clark.
The railroad officially reached Clark City on November 22, 1882.

event.title: was renamed Livingston in honor of a Northern Pacific Railway stockholder and director, Johnston Livingston (1875

data.event: At that time, the community moved to its present location upstream from the trading post and was renamed Livingston in honor of a Northern Pacific Railway stockholder and director, Johnston Livingston (1875–81 and 1884–87).
